did.unittitle: Wagner Free Institute of Science Westbrook Free Lectureship records

bioghist.p: Richard Brodhead Westbrook (1820-1899) was a well-known lawyer and Presbyterian minister. He was a Trustee of the Wagner Free Institute of Science from 1884 until his death in 1899. He was appointed Treasurer in 1885. He received an honorary degree from the Institute in the same year. In his will, he established an endowment for the Richard B. Westbrook Free Lectureship, which began in 1912.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, announcements, notes and newspaper clippings relating to the Westbrook Lectureship, 1946-1973, syllabi for the lectures from 1912 to 1957 and postcard-size announcements for lectures from 1958 to 1981. (No lectures were held for the years 1964 and 1965.)Also included are 8 x 10 inch announcements for lectures from 1931 to 1960 (some years are missing).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
